info.title: Goal of the study: to find out how humans perceive Recurring Pattern (RP) in real world scenes
info.rp-tutorial: Need a refresher on "Recurring Pattern"? Click here: Understanding Recurring Pattern
info.warning-msg:
During Preview, if no perceived Recurring Patterns are found, you can SKIP this image.
To get HIT approved properly, make sure you have seen this tutorial Understanding Recurring Pattern AND submit your WorkerID through the background survey.
info.warning-no-rp: No RP selected. Please click the Add button first!
info.rp-instruction:
1. Label every Recurring Pattern (RP) you perceive on each image.
  2. For each RP you perceived:
    • First click the Add button. A new RP button will be appeared and auto selected.
    • Then you can start labeling the perceived RP Instances by either Bounding Box or Polygon contour.
  3. Use mouse scroll to zoom in/out the image for more precise labeling.
  4. Click the Submit button or press ENTER to finish current task.
  5. Buttons & Hotkeys:
    1. Click Add button or press A to add a new RP.
    2. Click Remove button or press R to remove the selected RP.
    3. Click Bbox/Polygon button or press E to toggle between two labeling modes.
      • In Bbox mode, draw the bounding box of the RP instance by holding down left click.
      • In Polygon mode, draw the contour of the RP instance by left clicks. Press C to close the polygon.
    4. Click Label/Deletion flip switch or press D to toggle between labeling and deleting.
    5. Click the Undo Last button or press CTRL+Z to undo last Annotation/Deletion.
    6. Click the Reset View button or press CTRL+X center the image and reset zoom.
    7. Click the Clear All button to clear all annotations. Warning: this action cannot be recovered!
